summary: | Cover | So after much consideration I decided to “restart” my emerald Nuzlocke. Restart in quotes cause I’m just continuing...
caption:
| Cover |

So after much consideration I decided to “restart” my emerald Nuzlocke. Restart in quotes cause I’m just continuing from where the remakes left off. But since I’m doing that I thought I’d start a new blog for just the new version!~

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1304: Lopunny (Arceus)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1304: Lopunny (Arceus)
body:
Lopunny was a Pokemon that existed just to heal its team. This could help against spread damage, which could be nice. With the wide variety of decks at the time Lopunny was legal, having an advantage against one sort of deck was something worth taking a look at, even if it didn’t seem that impressive at first glance.

Lopunny’s 80 HP wasn’t all that great for a Stage 1, and the +20 Fighting Weakness made it bait for the many Fighting-types seeing play at the time. The one positive Lopunny had in its stats was a relatively low Retreat Cost. 1 Energy wasn’t too bad.

Healing Shower was a Poke-Power that gave Lopunny its reason to even be considered for a deck. Once during your turn, you could discard an Energy card from your hand. If you did, you removed a damage counter from each of your Pokemon. This could at least get rid of damage from the likes of Kingdra, Flygon, or even your own Donphan, but the Energy discard was a pain for only 10 damage per Pokemon.

Hover Heal did 40 damage for 2 Colorless Energy and removed all Special Conditions from Lopunny. Not really worth it.

Lopunny was useful only in decks that wanted to protect against spread damage and could make use of discarded Energy. This was an extremely narrow niche that almost never found use in reality. Due to this, Lopunny was basically never seen despite technically doing something other Pokemon couldn’t.

Healing Shower was a Poke-Power that gave Lopunny its reason to even be considered for a deck. Once during your turn, you could discard an Energy card from your hand. summary: the breloom grimaced, honestly confused at the small fire cat. “Er.. no? You wouldn’t call a fish eating another fish or a bird...
caption:
the breloom grimaced, honestly confused at the small fire cat.

“Er.. no? You wouldn’t call a fish eating another fish or a bird eating another bird cannibalism? Don’t overthink it, please.”

@im-crow

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

((pokemon gijinka au by Ray))
((More information of the au can be found here)

summary: Ask: Your trainer is gone? I am sorry about that. Is it okay if I pet you for a little? You are very cute and you remind me of...
caption:
Ask: Your trainer is gone? I am sorry about that. Is it okay if I pet you for a little? You are very cute and you remind me of someone

Cuky: Of course you can pet me! And don’t worry about my trainer~

I don’t think about them. We don’t need to focus on the bad things, right?
But hey hey! Even if I remind you of someone, aren’t I still cuter???

@ask-host-kiku​
